intro: Pleurothyrium obscurinerve, commonly known as the dark-veined pleurothyrium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent, dark-colored veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are drupes, containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy pulp. This species is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
